means: 波动，涨落，起伏( fluctuate的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Fluctuating prices usually base on a fickle public's demand.
sentence.Network_cn: 物价的波动往往是由于群众需求的不稳定而引起的.

sentence.Network_en: In many applications a fluctuating DC current is undesirable.
sentence.Network_cn: 在许多应用场合,波动的直流电是讨厌的.

sentence.Network_en: Widely fluctuating exchange rates may adversely affect international trade.
sentence.Network_cn: 浮动幅度很大的汇率可能会对国际贸易产生有害的影响.

entry.def: If something fluctuates, it changes a lot in an irregular way.

example.ex: Body temperature can fluctuate if you are ill.
example.tran: 人患病后体温可能会上下波动。

auth_sentence.content: I have never had a job with such fluctuating hours before.
